problem_text:
19.26. (Y. O. Hamidoune). Suppose that A and B are finite subsets of a group G such that |A| ⩾ 2 and |B| ⩾ 2, and let A ·2 B denote the set of elements of G which can be expressed in the form ab for at least two different (a, b) ∈ A × B. Is it true that |A| + |B| − (1/2)|AB| − (1/2)|A ·2 B| ⩽ max{2, |gH| : H ⩽ G, g ∈ G, gH ⊆ A ·2 B}?
This is proved if G is abelian.
W. Dicks
